intro: Wahlenbergia calcarea, commonly known as the limestone gentian, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, often on limestone outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Wahlenbergia calcarea is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other gentian-like plants.
